reviews.review_msg: Super boring and difficult. Readings made zero sense and assignments (25% each) worth marked unbelievably hard. GPA plunker

Awesome prof. Super helpful, very friendly and interested in her students. Class feels like a family near the end. The assignments are not very clear, but they are worth doing because you really do learn a lot.

This Class is easy if you show up and participate, Ching was very kind and took time to connect with students. Her instructions can be unclear or confusing at times, but she is always willing to answer questions in person or via email. I would highly recommend taking a class with Ching!

Ching's assignment and work requires a deep understanding of the concepts + material that are being taught. She is easily approachable and super considerate; she will help guide you in the right direction if you have any questions or concerns. Course heavily relies on participation and collaboration with others.

She is a caring professor only if you are in good terms with her. She expects a lot from her students so you need to show that you care about the class and show effort put into your work. Sometimes, students would get their feelings hurt because of the way she uses her words- very direct, strong/harsh words that can often make you upset.

The best prof that I've had at SFU. Ching truly cares for each of her students. I willingly woke up at 5am to get to her class because I had so much fun. There's a lot of participation, but she really helps you build on your self-confidence. I'm hoping to have her as my prof again!
Amazing prof. Attendance is mandatory but the class is really fun and mostly led by student presentations with class activities. Received an A+ because the assignments were fun!

Great professor! Professor Ching really cares about individual students. She is the first professor I have had to personally email me when I was absent to ensure I was up to speed. On the first day of class, she brought everyone coffee.

I don't know why Ann isn't rated higher. I always found her classes interesting, relevant and open to discussion. She always gave plenty of time, both in and out of class for assignments and was open to new ideas.  Sure, there is a lot of reading and writing, but I would say the class is worth it!

I'm taking Addisu Bailie at UFV, but the listing for him at UFV is not yet created. I know AIS299 is a useless class, but Addisu's class is worse than useless. His online class feels like he did the bare minimum, using videos from 12 years ago for Indigenization units. He also has assignments that are less helpful than high school planning classes.
Addisu is very kind, however, the lectures were extremely dry. He's a pretty easy marker, but just make sure you participate as much as you can.
I had Addisu as a TA for educ252 and he always gave good feedback and overall, wanted us to succeed!

Lectures were often unfocused but class discussions were well led and interesting. Weekly readings were required and often hard to understand. Group work based on case studies was submitted every 2 weeks or so. Final portfolio requirements were very unclear with changing descriptions and instructions.

I took this class with her, we basically use self evaluation, everyone gave them at least an A- I swear. And I think we are all very satisfied with overall mark, however, it's a confusing course. She didn't make statements of what she wants, we can basically do anything we "wanted" to do, if you let her know in advance. Very nice teacher, helpful.

Excellent Prof. Really tries to engage students in the dialogues and discourses that are taking place around them. Really tries to develop the reflective practitioner in her students by asking fundamental questions:Who am I? Who am I in Context? Group project was a really great way to be critical about things and ponder on what they have to offer.

Marela is such an awesome prof! The class is easy. It involves group project, easy group assignments, NO TESTS, and a final essay, and easy group project. It's an easy go fun Education class based on reflective practice

Nice lady but this class is really pointless. Did not learn anything and I was never interested at any point in the four hour class. She's an easy marker and the assignments aren't hard but its boring

She was 1 of the most understanding and helpful professors I have ever had at SFU over the last 6 yrs, She tries hard to make everyone interested and hence she is always available for extra help. She goes out of her way to be helpful and fair to her students; open minded regarding her teaching so everyone can be engaged which is great fair grading
such a sweet and caring professor. she will understand your situtations and give extentions to any work. always ask if you are uncertain and she will definately assit you

Extremely unprofessional. Sandy played favourites, was biased in grading, and made inappropriate personal comments. She even told me, “I love you,” which crossed a serious boundary and left me deeply uncomfortable. Not a safe or respectful learning environment. Would not recommend.

Sandy was great!! As long as you wrote a few paragraphs every week (or every other week even) on the weekly modules you were good. Just reflect & connect w the material & practice reading it out loud to be reading for the small group presentations. The presentations (although some ppl get scarred at first) are really chill. 5-6 ppl per presentation

BEST prof I've had. Awesome teaching style .She cares so much about you/your success/learning. No tests- just weekly reading logs and a term project (flexible criteria). She will try to accommodate for your needs. Be engaged in class- do your readings on time or you'll feel guilty & won't be able to participate in discussions as easily.

One of the best profs I've had so far! Eleonora has a super open-minded and creative personality which made the course extremely interesting and enjoyable. The course is very engaging and discussion-heavy but you will not be forced to speak. The course material and assignments are thought-provoking and relatively easy to complete. Highly recommend!
She is very nice, flexible. and she does not have final, we used learning portfolio as a final project. easy marker. her class was great.

If youre on this rate my prof to decide whether or not to take Charles class - DO IT. He is an amazing lecturer and is very passionate about the material. I would undoubtedly take another class with Charles if the opportunity arose!!!!

This class was a disaster from start to finish. We had few instructions on how to do our assignments and reflections, and Colleen graded them based on her subjective opinion rather than what she told us in class. I did all the items for participation, and my final grade was surprising, considering the little feedback I got. Very disorganized.

Whether it is your first or last time teaching a course, you don't run a course like Colleen did with 252 this semester. It is insane to me how SFU allows professors to run a course where we do not even know how we are being marked and allows them to change things whenever they want, to the detriment of students. Don't take this course with her.

As a BGS student, this course has made me question whether or not I want to be a teacher. We had multiple assignments given to us at the last minute; some were changed while I was working on them, and we could only go off of what Colleen said verbally, as she refused to document anything. I regret taking this course; it has been very stressful.

Colleen is an activist masquerading as a professor. As long as you can fake enthusiasm for her teaching methods and course content you can get a decent mark, but you won't learn anything of value. This course had lots of stuff to do we never went over in class, and many assignments were dropped/changed last minute. Don't take a course with her.

This is less of a reflective teaching course and more of a reflecting in a progressive way course. Colleen is very disorganized and I wish I took the other course section this term. She has not addressed any of my concerns about my grade, and assigns things to read we never go over in class or use as assignments. Lots of wasted time in this course.

She told us this is her first time teaching this course. There was no syllabus at enrollment time, no course outline during our first week either and canvas was blank. She said she embraced a style of teaching where she could do whatever she wanted and we had to go along with it. I dropped the class. Disorganized is right, don't take her courses.
Best prof ever! Made me actually excited to come to class and learn. The course is structured so you can move at your own pace, and he's so understanding, helpful, and knowledgeable!

Cary's class is very open ended and it is clear he wants to see his students engage with the content in their own way. He is very kind and is always willing to help out. He somehow manages to make an online asynchronous class engaging and memorable which is no easy feat.

Great prof! Cary provided many resources to learn from and was easy to reach and get feedback from outside of class. The course (online) was fairly disorganized but was still fun and a helpful learning experience overall.

This course was a great learning experience. Make sure you are actively engaged with the other discussion posts as well as taking the time to thoughtfully formulate your own answers. Cary provided many resources to use for the weekly discussion posts. He also responds to emails very quickly and was helpful when I asked for clarification on things.
Nicest prof ever when I did this last spring. If she teaches again, take her.

Cher is an amazing prof. You have to work hard and put in the effort, but she definitely rewards the hard work. EXTREMELY student centered and will do what works best for her students, not what works best for her. I wish she taught more often! If you see her name on an outline, take the course--you won't regret it!

A very caring professor.  Cher really wants her students to get the most out of the class and expects full participation.  Do the readings, record your reflections after every class and offer your perspectives - this is a challening class in a great environment and will give you a strong foundation for PDP.
Great Prof ever!!!!! SO GOOD!!!She cares about all her students, she knows what she is teaching, she knows how to teach!!!! Great Prof!! I wish she can teach all my classes!!!!!

The most amazing proff I've ever had in my university career, I honestly wish she taught all my classes! She genuinely cares about all her students and is always looking for ways to self improve. i loved her!
One of the best professors I've had in my four years of undergrad at SFU.

Susan is one of the most caring professors at SFU. Her many years in the education system as a teacher and principal help her shine in her role as a professor. The assignments in this course are clearly laid out and students have the freedom to do them however they chose. Susan also gives very extensive feedback which helps you along the way.
